ovh-datasource-cloud-region.body:
data "cloud_region" "$1" {
    # region - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    region = ""

    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used.
    project_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the project concatenated with the name of the region.
In addition, the following attributes are exported:
    # "continent_code" - the code of the geographic continent the region is running.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "datacenter_location" - The location code of the datacenter.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "continentCode" - (Deprecated) Use "continent_code" instead.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "datacenterLocation" - (Deprecated) Use "datacenter_location" instead.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "services" - The list of public cloud services running within the region
    # "name" - the name of the public cloud service
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "status" - the status of the service
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
}
ovh-datasource-cloud-region.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about a region associated with a
public cloud project. The region must be associated with the project.

ovh-datasource-cloud-regions.body:
data "cloud_regions" "$1" {
    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,
    project_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the project. In addition, the following attributes
are exported:
    # "names" - The list of regions associated with the project
}
ovh-datasource-cloud-regions.description: Use this data source to get the regions of a public cloud project.

ovh-datasource-domain-zone.body:
data "domain_zone" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the domain zone.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the domain zone name.
In addition, the following attributes are exported:
    # "last_update" - Last update date of the DNS zone
    # "has_dns_anycast" - hasDnsAnycast flag of the DNS zone
    # "name_servers" - Name servers that host the DNS zone
    # "dnssec_supported" - Is DNSSEC supported by this zone
}
ovh-datasource-domain-zone.description: Use this data source to retrieve information about a domain zone.

ovh-datasource-iploadbalancing.body:
data "iploadbalancing" "$1" {
    # zone - (Optional) Location where your service is. This takes an array of values.
    zone = ""

    # offer - (Optional) The offer of your IP load balancing
    offer = ""

    # service_name - (Optional) The internal name of your IP load balancing
    service_name = ""

    # ip_loadbalancing - (Optional) Your IP load balancing
    ip_loadbalancing = ""

    # state - (Optional) Current state of your IP. Can take any of the following value: "blacklisted", "deleted", "free", "ok", "quarantined", "suspended"
    state = ""

    # vrack_eligibility - (Optional) Vrack eligibility. Takes a boolean value.
    vrack_eligibility = ""

    # vrack_name - (Optional) Name of the vRack on which the current Load Balancer is attached to, as it is named on vRack product
    vrack_name = ""

    # ssl_configuration - (Optional) Modern oldest compatible clients : Firefox 27, Chrome 30, IE 11 on Windows 7, Edge, Opera 17, Safari 9, Android 5.0, and Java 8. Intermediate oldest compatible clients : Firefox 1, Chrome 1, IE 7, Opera 5, Safari 1, Windows XP IE8, Android 2.3, Java 7. Can take any of the following value: "intermediate", "modern"
    ssl_configuration = ""

    # display_name - (Optional) the name displayed in ManagerV6 for your iplb (max 50 chars)
    display_name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the service_name of your IP load balancing
In addition, the following attributes are exported:
    # "metrics_token" - The metrics token associated with your IP load balancing This attribute is sensitive.
    # "orderable_zone" - Available additional zone for your Load Balancer "name" - The zone three letter code
    # "plan_code" - The billing planCode for this zone
    # "orderable_zone" - Available additional zone for your Load Balancer "name" - The zone three letter code
    # "orderable_zone" - Available additional zone for your Load Balancer "name" - The zone three letter code
}
ovh-datasource-iploadbalancing.description: Use this data source to retrieve information about an iploadbalancing product.

ovh-datasource-me-paymentmean-bankaccoun.body:
data "me_paymentmean_bankaccount" "$1" {
    # description_regexp - (Optional) a regexp used to filter bank accounts  on their `description` attributes.
    description_regexp = ""

    # use_default - (Optional) Retrieve bank account marked as default payment mean.
    use_default = ""

    # use_oldest - (Optional) Retrieve oldest bank account. project.
    use_oldest = ""

    # state - (Optional) Filter bank accounts on their `state` attribute. Can be "blockedForIncidents", "valid", "pendingValidation"
    state = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the bank account payment mean
    # "description" - the description attribute of the bank account
    # "state" - (Optional) Filter bank accounts on their "state" attribute. Can be "blockedForIncidents", "valid", "pendingValidation"
    # "default" - a boolean which tells if the retrieved bank account
    # "state" - (Optional) Filter bank accounts on their "state" attribute. Can be "blockedForIncidents", "valid", "pendingValidation"
}
ovh-datasource-me-paymentmean-bankaccoun.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about a bank account
payment mean associated with an OVH account.

ovh-datasource-me-paymentmean-creditcard.body:
data "me_paymentmean_creditcard" "$1" {
    # description_regexp - (Optional) a regexp used to filter credit cards  on their `description` attributes.
    description_regexp = ""

    # use_default - (Optional) Retrieve credit card marked as default payment mean.
    use_default = ""

    # use_last_to_expire - (Optional) Retrieve the credit card that will be the last to expire according to its expiration date.
    use_last_to_expire = ""

    # states - (Optional) Filter credit cards on their `state` attribute. Can be "expired", "valid", "tooManyFailures"
    states = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the credit card payment mean
    # "description" - the description attribute of the credit card
    # "states" - (Optional) Filter credit cards on their "state" attribute. Can be "expired", "valid", "tooManyFailures"
    # "state" - the state attribute of the credit card
    # "states" - (Optional) Filter credit cards on their "state" attribute. Can be "expired", "valid", "tooManyFailures"
    # "default" - a boolean which tells if the retrieved credit card
    # "states" - (Optional) Filter credit cards on their "state" attribute. Can be "expired", "valid", "tooManyFailures"
}
ovh-datasource-me-paymentmean-creditcard.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about a credit card
payment mean associated with an OVH account.

ovh-datasource-publiccloud-region.body:
data "publiccloud_region" "$1" {
    # region - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    region = ""

    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used.
    project_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the project concatenated with the name of the region.
In addition, the following attributes are exported:
    # "continent_code" - the code of the geographic continent the region is running.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "datacenter_location" - The location code of the datacenter.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "continentCode" - (Deprecated) Use "continent_code" instead.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "datacenterLocation" - (Deprecated) Use "datacenter_location" instead.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "services" - The list of public cloud services running within the region
    # "name" - the name of the public cloud service
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "status" - the status of the service
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
    # "region" - (Required) The name of the region associated with the public cloud project.
}
ovh-datasource-publiccloud-region.description:
__DEPRECATED__ use `ovh_cloud_region` instead. Use this data source to retrieve information about a region associated with a
public cloud project. The region must be associated with the project.

ovh-datasource-publiccloud-regions.body:
data "publiccloud_regions" "$1" {
    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,
    project_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" is set to the ID of the project. In addition, the following attributes
are exported:
    # "names" - The list of regions associated with the project
}
ovh-datasource-publiccloud-regions.description: __DEPRECATED__ use `ovh_cloud_regions` instead. Use this data source to get the regions of a public cloud project.

ovh-resource-cloud-network-private.body:
resource "cloud_network_private" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the network.
    name = ""

    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used.
    project_id = ""

    # vlan_id - (Optional) a vlan id to associate with the network.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to 0.
    vlan_id = ""

    # regions - (Optional) an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    regions = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "project_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "vlan_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "regions" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "regions_status" - A map representing the status of the network per region.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "regions_status/region" - The id of the region.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "regions_status/status" - The status of the network in the region.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "status" - the status of the network. should be normally set to 'ACTIVE'.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "type" - the type of the network. Either 'private' or 'public'. 
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
}
ovh-resource-cloud-network-private.description: Creates a private network in a public cloud project.

ovh-resource-cloud-network-private-subne.body:
resource "cloud_network_private_subnet" "$1" {
    # network - (Required) Global network in CIDR format.  Changing this value recreates the subnet
    network = ""

    # end - (Required) Last ip for this region.  Changing this value recreates the subnet.
    end = ""

    # start - (Required) First ip for this region.  Changing this value recreates the subnet.
    start = ""

    # network_id - (Required) The id of the network.  Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    network_id = ""

    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    project_id = ""

    # dhcp - (Optional) Enable DHCP.  Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to false. _
    dhcp = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which the network subnet will be created.  Ex.: "GRA1". Changing this value recreates the resource.
    region = ""

    # no_gateway - (Optional) Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    no_gateway = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "project_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "network_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "dhcp_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "start" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "end" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "network" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "gateway_ip" - The IP of the gateway
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "no_gateway" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "cidr" - Ip Block representing the subnet cidr.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools" - List of ip pools allocated in the subnet.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/network" - Global network with cidr.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/region" - Region where this subnet is created.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/dhcp" - DHCP enabled.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/end" - Last ip for this region.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/start" - First ip for this region.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
}
ovh-resource-cloud-network-private-subne.description: Creates a subnet in a private network of a public cloud project.

ovh-resource-cloud-user.body:
resource "ovh_cloud_user" "$1" {
    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used.
    project_id = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description associated with the user.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "project_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "username" - the username generated for the user. This username can be used with
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "password" - (Sensitive) the password generated for the user. The password can
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "status" - the status of the user. should be normally set to 'ok'.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "creation_date" - the date the user was created.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "openstack_rc" - a convenient map representing an openstack_rc file.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
}
ovh-resource-cloud-user.description: Creates a user in a public cloud project.

ovh-resource-domain-zone-record.body:
resource "ovh_domain_zone_record" "$1" {
    # fieldtype - (Required) The type of the record
    fieldtype = ""

    # target - (Required) The value of the record
    target = ""

    # subdomain - (Required) The name of the record
    subdomain = ""

    # zone - (Required) The domain to add the record to
    zone = ""

    # ttl - (Optional) The TTL of the record
    ttl = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The record ID
    # "zone" - The domain to add the record to
    # "subDomain" - The name of the record
    # "target" - The value of the record
    # "fieldType" - The type of the record
    # "ttl" - The TTL of the record
}
ovh-resource-domain-zone-record.description: Provides a OVH domain zone record.

ovh-resource-domain-zone-redirection.body:
resource "ovh_domain_zone_redirection" "$1" {
    # type - (Required) The type of the redirection, with values:
    type = ""

    # target - (Required) The value of the redirection
    target = ""

    # zone - (Required) The domain to add the redirection to
    zone = ""

    # subdomain - (Optional) The name of the redirection
    subdomain = ""

    # visible - (Optional) `visible` -> Redirection by http code 302
    visible = ""

    # invisible - (Optional) `invisible` -> Redirection by html frame
    invisible = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description of this redirection
    description = ""

    # keywords - (Optional) Keywords to describe this redirection
    keywords = ""

    # title - (Optional) Title of this redirection
    title = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The redirection ID
    # "zone" - The domain to add the redirection to
    # "subDomain" - The name of the redirection
    # "target" - The value of the redirection
    # "type" - The type of the redirection
    # "description" - The description of the redirection
    # "keywords" - Keywords  of the redirection
    # "title" - The title of the redirection
}
ovh-resource-domain-zone-redirection.description: Provides a OVH domain zone redirection.

ovh-resource-iploadbalancing-http-route.body:
resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_route" "$1" {
    # service_name - (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing
    service_name = ""

    # display_name - (Optional) Human readable name for your route, this field is for you
    display_name = ""

    # weight - (Optional) Route priority ([0..255]). 0 if null. Highest priority routes are evaluated first. Only the first matching route will trigger an action
    weight = ""

    # frontend_id - (Optional) Route traffic for this frontend
    frontend_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "service_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "display_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "weight" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "action.status" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "action.target" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "action.type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "frontend_id" - See Argument Reference above.
}
ovh-resource-iploadbalancing-http-route.description: Manage http route for a loadbalancer service

ovh-resource-iploadbalancing-http-route-.body:
resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_route_rule" "$1" {
    # match - (Required) Matching operator. Not all operators are available for all fields. See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/availableRouteRules"
    match = ""

    # field - (Required) Name of the field to match like "protocol" or "host". See "/ipLoadbalancing/{serviceName}/availableRouteRules" for a list of available rules
    field = ""

    # route_id - (Required) The route to apply this rule
    route_id = ""

    # service_name - (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing
    service_name = ""

    # display_name - (Optional) Human readable name for your rule, this field is for you
    display_name = ""

    # negate - (Optional) Invert the matching operator effect
    negate = ""

    # pattern - (Optional) Value to match against this match. Interpretation if this field depends on the match and field
    pattern = ""

    # sub_field - (Optional) Name of sub-field, if applicable. This may be a Cookie or Header name for instance
    sub_field = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "service_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "route_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "display_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "field" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "match" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "negate" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "pattern" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "sub_field" - See Argument Reference above.
}

ovh-resource-iploadbalancing-tcp-farm.body:
resource "iploadbalancing_tcp_farm" "$1" {
    # type - (Required) Valid values : `http`, `internal`, `mysql`, `oko`, `pgsql`, `smtp`, `tcp`
    type = ""

    # zone - (Required) Zone where the farm will be defined (ie. `GRA`, `BHS` also supports `ALL`)
    zone = ""

    # service_name - (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing
    service_name = ""

    # balance - (Optional) Load balancing algorithm. `roundrobin` if null (`first`, `leastconn`, `roundrobin`, `source`)
    balance = ""

    # display_name - (Optional) Readable label for loadbalancer farm
    display_name = ""

    # port - (Optional) Port attached to your farm ([1..49151]). Inherited from frontend if null
    port = ""

    # stickiness - (Optional) 	Stickiness type. No stickiness if null (`sourceIp`)
    stickiness = ""

    # vrack_network_id - (Optional) Internal Load Balancer identifier of the vRack private network to attach to your farm, mandatory when your Load Balancer is attached to a vRack
    vrack_network_id = ""

    # probe - (Optional) define a backend healthcheck probe
    probe = ""

    # interval - (Optional) probe interval, Value between 30 and 3600 seconds, default 30
    interval = ""

    # match - (Optional) What to mach `pattern` against (`contains`, `default`, `internal`, `matches`, `status`)
    match = ""

    # port - (Optional) Port for backends to recieve traffic on.
    port = ""

    # negate - (Optional) Negate probe result
    negate = ""

    # pattern - (Optional) Pattern to match against `match`
    pattern = ""

    # force_ssl - (Optional) Force use of SSL (TLS)
    force_ssl = ""

    # url - (Optional) URL for HTTP probe type.
    url = ""

    # method - (Optional) HTTP probe method (`GET`, `HEAD`, `OPTIONS`, `internal`)
    method = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "service_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "balance" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "display_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "port" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "stickiness" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "vrack_network_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "zone" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "probe" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "type" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "interval" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "match" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "port" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "negate" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "pattern" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "force_ssl" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "url" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "method" - See Argument Reference above.
}
ovh-resource-iploadbalancing-tcp-farm.description: Creates a backend server group (farm) to be used by loadbalancing frontend(s)

ovh-resource-iploadbalancing-tcp-farm-se.body:
resource "iploadbalancing_tcp_farm_server" "$1" {
    # service_name - (Required) The internal name of your IP load balancing
    service_name = ""

    # farm_id - (Optional) ID of the farm this server is attached to
    farm_id = ""

    # display_name - (Optional) Label for the server
    display_name = ""

    # address - (Optional) Address of the backend server (IP from either internal or OVH network)
    address = ""

    # status - (Optional) `active` or `inactive`
    status = ""

    # port - (Optional) Port that backend will respond on
    port = ""

    # proxy_protocol_version - (Optional) version of the PROXY protocol used to pass origin connection information from loadbalancer to recieving service (`v1`, `v2`, `v2-ssl`, `v2-ssl-cn`)
    proxy_protocol_version = ""

    # weight - (Optional) used in loadbalancing algorithm
    weight = ""

    # probe - (Optional) defines if backend will be probed to determine health and keep as active in farm if healthy
    probe = ""

    # ssl - (Optional) is the connection ciphered with SSL (TLS)
    ssl = ""

    # backup - (Optional) is it a backup server used in case of failure of all the non-backup backends
    backup = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "service_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "farm_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "display_name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "address" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "status" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "port" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "proxy_protocol_version" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "weight" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "probe" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "ssl" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "backup" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "cookie" - Value of the stickiness cookie used for this backend.
}
ovh-resource-iploadbalancing-tcp-farm-se.description: Creates a backend server entry linked to loadbalancing group (farm)

ovh-resource-publiccloud-private-network.body:
resource "publiccloud_private_network" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the network.
    name = ""

    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used.
    project_id = ""

    # vlan_id - (Optional) a vlan id to associate with the network.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to 0.
    vlan_id = ""

    # regions - (Optional) an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    regions = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "project_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "name" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "vlan_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "regions" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "regions_status" - A map representing the status of the network per region.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "regions_status/region" - The id of the region.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "regions_status/status" - The status of the network in the region.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "status" - the status of the network. should be normally set to 'ACTIVE'.
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
    # "type" - the type of the network. Either 'private' or 'public'. 
    # "regions" - an array of valid OVH public cloud region ID in which the network  will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions.
}
ovh-resource-publiccloud-private-network.description:
__DEPRECATED__ use `ovh_cloud_network_private` instead.
Creates a private network in a public cloud project.

ovh-resource-publiccloud-private-network.body:
resource "publiccloud_private_network_subnet" "$1" {
    # network - (Required) Global network in CIDR format.  Changing this value recreates the subnet
    network = ""

    # end - (Required) Last ip for this region.  Changing this value recreates the subnet.
    end = ""

    # start - (Required) First ip for this region.  Changing this value recreates the subnet.
    start = ""

    # network_id - (Required) The id of the network.  Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    network_id = ""

    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.
    project_id = ""

    # dhcp - (Optional) Enable DHCP.  Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Defaults to false. _
    dhcp = ""

    # region - (Optional) The region in which the network subnet will be created.  Ex.: "GRA1". Changing this value recreates the resource.
    region = ""

    # no_gateway - (Optional) Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    no_gateway = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "project_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "network_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "dhcp_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "start" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "end" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "network" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "region" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "gateway_ip" - The IP of the gateway
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "no_gateway" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "cidr" - Ip Block representing the subnet cidr.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools" - List of ip pools allocated in the subnet.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/network" - Global network with cidr.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/region" - Region where this subnet is created.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/dhcp" - DHCP enabled.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/end" - Last ip for this region.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
    # "ip_pools/start" - First ip for this region.
    # "no_gateway" - Set to true if you don't want to set a default gateway IP.  Changing this value recreates the resource. Defaults to false.
}
ovh-resource-publiccloud-private-network.description:
__DEPRECATED__ use `ovh_cloud_network_private_subnet` instead.
Creates a subnet in a private network of a public cloud project.

ovh-resource-publiccloud-user.body:
resource "publiccloud_user" "$1" {
    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used.
    project_id = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description associated with the user.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "project_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "description" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "username" - the username generated for the user. This username can be used with
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "password" - (Sensitive) the password generated for the user. The password can
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "status" - the status of the user. should be normally set to 'ok'.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "creation_date" - the date the user was created.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
    # "openstack_rc" - a convenient map representing an openstack_rc file.
    # "description" - A description associated with the user.
}
ovh-resource-publiccloud-user.description:
__DEPRECATED__ use `ovh_cloud_user` instead.
Creates a user in a public cloud project.

ovh-resource-vrack-cloudproject.body:
resource "vrack_cloudproject" "$1" {
    # project_id - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the `OVH_PROJECT_ID` environment variable is used.
    project_id = ""

    # vrack_id - (Required) The id of the vrack. If omitted, the `OVH_VRACK_ID`   environment variable is used.
    vrack_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "vrack_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "project_id" - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the "OVH_PROJECT_ID" environment variable is used.
    # "project_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "project_id" - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the "OVH_PROJECT_ID" environment variable is used.
}
ovh-resource-vrack-cloudproject.description: Attach an existing public cloud project to an existing VRack.

    # "project_id" - See Argument Reference above.
    # "project_id" - (Required) The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,   the "OVH_PROJECT_ID" environment variable is used.
}
